name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"816b3997-c939-4c66-a5a9-6f0d22073dd9","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: visit_Lambda","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9a50de01-f516-4c93-84e8-23e16bdc5fef","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visit_Lambda","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function handles Python's anonymous functions (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"lambda x: x + 1","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). Since lambdas don't have inherent names like standard functions defined with ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"def","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", this method is responsible for assigning them a unique identity, creating their execution context, and integrating them into the analysis just like any other named function.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f03ea5a9-eb90-4755-88d1-ca9d803061b5","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Lambdas are often used for quick, inline logic (like sorting keys or callbacks). Even though they are "anonymous," a static analyzer must track them to understand data flow. If a lambda is passed to a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"map","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function, the analyzer needs to know what arguments that lambda accepts and what it returns, otherwise the analysis chain breaks.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"68bd9561-52c6-4f14-b2b7-3ab5fa0fc403","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"64d35def-e5ea-4689-a51d-f8307ea4c610","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Unique Naming:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[{"id":"15157b4c-003f-49ba-8933-80bc981ba3a2","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Because lambdas have no name, the function generates one. It consults the current scope's counter to create a unique identifier, such as ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<lambda_1>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<lambda_2>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", etc.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6ad2351e-fa1b-4df9-a926-21a575fc8154","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This ensures that multiple lambdas on the same line or in the same block don't collide.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"981e6766-80e9-454a-a981-6aa21f4627ce","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Scope Creation:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[{"id":"0d995350-b2d7-4ca2-935c-2ab81f2b9584","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It creates a new, distinct scope for the lambda using the generated name (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module.function.<lambda_1>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f288e11a-db81-4169-8242-ca12c693e7df","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is crucial because variables defined inside the lambda (like its arguments) must be isolated from the outer scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"34caca1d-8faa-4855-8a03-d48d5a66052e","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Definition Handler:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[{"id":"76eb144a-86d2-4217-a85f-05c9833c38b0","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It delegates the heavy lifting of parameter analysis to ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"_handle_function_def","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This shared helper treats the lambda just like a regular function, processing its arguments (e.g., the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"lambda x: ...","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") and creating the necessary Definition objects.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"838166f8-4c17-4407-b8c5-46f76db48c01","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Registration:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[{"id":"571062c0-b08c-4f48-9aee-ebd3d92c3139","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Finally, it registers this synthetic "lambda function" in the current scope so it can be referenced later.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"260a91da-6817-4ee2-9317-0cc6b5181331","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Code:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"13b4fece-48ba-4ea0-8a41-7eb27f11476f","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"squares = map(lambda n: n**2, numbers)","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5ed39953-8387-4c2f-92ed-75f3c0c69fb4","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Analysis:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e3b9955f-859b-464a-890b-5d2ca4d94b02","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"visit_Lambda","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" encounters the lambda expression.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f865f3c7-88a3-41ef-b698-e49cd7996873","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It asks the current scope for a count and generates the name ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<lambda_1>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6db04428-7c4f-442e-9978-870f4f9298a4","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It creates a scope ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"main.<lambda_1>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"629062ca-b645-4e69-912e-9b644903724c","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It calls ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"_handle_function_def","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which identifies ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"n","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as an argument.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f1234190-16fd-4b16-b644-d5dc7cfe183a","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It registers ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<lambda_1>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"main","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"35d01afc-435d-4056-bd49-d1d6e576a1f4","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, the analyzer sees ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"map","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" being called with a function named ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"main.<lambda_1>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", allowing it to trace the data flow of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"n","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cf6f335e-53bc-4224-8575-936362c302f7","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
